title: Yellen Says TikTok-Like Data Security Risks Are Growing More Common
description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen, who oversees an interagency task force that’s reviewing national security concerns around TikTok Inc., said she’s seeing a growing number of situations that have raised concerns similar to those prompted by the app.

title: US, Canada Close in on Deal to Prevent Border Crossings
description: The US and Canada are poised to announce a deal to rewrite an immigration accord that has driven people to cross the border between the two countries by land to refile asylum claims, a key irritant between the governments, people familiar with the talks say.

title: Five Key Moments From TikTok CEO’s Combative Hearing in Congress
description: TikTok CEO Shou Chew sought to protect his company from a potential US ban or forced sale during a four-and-a-half hour congressional hearing that rarely deviated from the hostile note on which it began.

title: Trump Urges Court to Uphold His Absolute Immunity Claim in Jan. 6 Lawsuits
description: Donald Trump urged a federal appeals court to disregard the Justice Department’s decision to reject his claim of absolute immunity against civil lawsuits seeking to hold the former president responsible for the Jan. 6 US Capitol attack.

title: Ontario Edges Closer to Balanced Budget as Population Booms
description: Ontario is close to balancing its budget in the coming year, with higher revenue from income tax and federal government transfers helping offset an anticipated economic slowdown in Canada’s most-populous province.

title: House Republicans Finalizing Offer to Biden on Debt-Ceiling Deal
description: House Republicans are finalizing a formal list of spending cuts they’ll demand from President Joe Biden in exchange for their support for raising the US debt ceiling, Budget Committee Chair Jodey Arrington told reporters.

title: Russian National Escapes From Italian House Arrest, Lawyer Says
description: A Russian national escaped on Wednesday from house arrest in Milan after a local court had approved his extradition to the US earlier this week.

title: Australia’s Left Poised for Rare Control of Entire Mainland
description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese’s center-left Labor party is on the cusp of holding power in every mainland state and territory for just the second time in the party’s 120-year history. Yet such dominance may prove a poisoned chalice.

title: Biden’s Top Diplomat Blasted By Republicans Over Chaotic Afghan Withdrawal
description: House Republicans hammered Secretary of State Antony Blinken Thursday over the chaotic US withdrawal from Afghanistan, threatening to subpoena a letter that highlighted internal dissent over the episode.

title: Oil Reserve Refill Is ‘Difficult’ This Year, US Energy Chief Says
description: US Energy Secretary Jennifer Granholm said it will be “difficult” this year to refill government oil reserves, even as crude prices hovered within the agency’s target buy-back range.

title: Colombia’s Leftist Government Suffers First Major Defeat in Congress
description: Colombian President Gustavo Petro suffered his first major setback in congress after the government withdrew a proposed bill to overhaul the political system.

title: Colombia’s Petro on Track to Suffer First Major Defeat in Congress
description: Colombian President Gustavo Petro is on track to suffer his first major setback in congress this week as his own party withdrew its support from a bill to overhaul the political system.

title: Hungary Sees Deal Near to Help Unlock €28 billion in EU Funds
description: Hungary said it’s near an agreement with the European Union that would bring it a step closer toward accessing almost €28 billion ($30.5 billion) in funds frozen over concerns about the rule of law and fundamental rights.

title: King Charles' Realm Is Poised to Shrink as Jamaica Considers Ditching Monarchy
description: The realm of King Charles III is on the verge of getting smaller.

title: UK Prime Minister Condemns ‘Unacceptable’ Power Trader Behavior
description: The UK government condemned tactics by power traders that the energy regulator says pushes up prices for consumers.

title: House Republicans Want Answers From Yellen, FDIC on Bank Failures
description: House Republicans asked Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen and FDIC Chair Martin Gruenberg for detailed answers on the failures of Silicon Valley Bank and Signature Bank, including on the efforts to sell the firms to private-sector buyers.

title: US Regulator Warns About Data Security During TikTok Hearing
description: Data security is a top concern for a secretive US panel of regulators with the power to block foreign transactions, a Treasury Department spokesperson said in a statement as House lawmakers grilled TikTok Inc.’s chief executive Thursday.

title: Maryland's Wes Moore Frames Abortion Access as Economic Issue
description: Wes Moore, the former CEO of Robin Hood, is considered a rising star in the Democratic party

title: Canada and IBM to Publish Chips Pact Amid Biden-Trudeau Visit
description: Canada and International Business Machines Corp. will publish a high-level agreement on expanding semiconductor cooperation on Friday, during US President Joe Biden’s visit to Ottawa.

title: Biden Leaves the Banking Crisis Decisions to Congress
description: As the global banking crisis stretches into its third week, President Joe Biden has turned to a familiar playbook — lay low and point the finger at Congress.

title: TikTok’s CEO Is Defiant as US Lawmakers Doubt Assurances on Safety
description: TikTok Chief Executive Shou Chew defended his company against a barrage of criticism from hostile US lawmakers, repeatedly asserting the app’s independence from its Chinese owners.

title: Manhattan DA Fires Back at Republicans’ Demand for Information on Trump Probe
description: Manhattan District Attorney Alvin Bragg’s office fired back at House Judiciary Chairman Jim Jordan’s demands for information about the DA’s grand jury investigation into Donald Trump, calling them “an unprecedented inquiry into a pending local prosecution.”

title: Lula Slams Brazil’s Central Bank as House Speaker Urges Truce
description: Brazil’s lower house Speaker Arthur Lira called for peace between the government and the central bank after it signaled no interest rate cut in the short term, while President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva renewed criticism of the autonomous monetary authority and its chief.

title: Poland’s Access to €75 Billion on the Line in Judiciary Dispute
description: Poland stands to lose out on more than €75 billion ($82 billion) in European Union budget funding if it fails to approve legislation giving its judiciary more independence, a process that was thrown into limbo last month.

title: Oil Tankers Divert Away From Strike-Ridden French Ports
description: More oil tankers have diverted away from France as strikes disrupt the country’s petroleum industry.

title: Biden Seeks Show of Unity in Visit With Trudeau: What to Watch
description: President Joe Biden on Thursday will make his first trip to Canada since taking office, meeting with Prime Minister Justin Trudeau.

title: BOE No Longer Expects UK Living Standards to Fall This Year
description: UK living standards will remain flat this year, according to the Bank of England, rather than sliding as previously expected.

title: Power Cuts Have Reduced Potential Size of South Africa Economy by a Fifth, PIC Says
description: Blackouts have reduced the potential size of South Africa’s economy by almost a fifth since they started being imposed around 2008, according to an energy specialist at Africa’s biggest fund manager.

title: Weed Banking Bill on Hold as Senate Deals With Financial Chaos
description: Legislation to open banking services to marijuana businesses has become a casualty — at least for now — of the financial turmoil brought on by the collapse of Silicon Valley Bank and Signature Bank.

title: Thai PM’s Party Vows to Prioritize Foreign Investments Ahead of May Election
description: Thai Prime Minister Prayuth Chan-Ocha’s political party will prioritize attracting foreign investments to bolster the country’s economic recovery, as the leader bids to stay in power ahead of the May general election.

title: UK Labour’s Starmer Vows to Take on Big Tech Over Knife Crime
description: Labour Party leader Keir Starmer vowed to take on big technology companies that profit from the sale of weapons or promote content that helps radicalize young people.

title: Israel Passes First Bit of Judicial Plan as Thousands in Streets
description: Israel’s Parliament approved early Thursday the first part of a planned judicial overhaul, reducing the authority of the legal system to declare the prime minister incapacitated, hours before thousands of Israelis took again to the streets to protest that and other planned changes.

title: Mexico Inflation Slows More Than Forecast in Relief for Banxico
description: Mexico’s inflation eased more than economists expected in early March, likely boosting the odds that the central bank will slow a record monetary tightening cycle at next week’s meeting.

title: Finland’s President Signs NATO Law as Accession Draws Nearer
description: Finnish President Sauli Niinisto signed the law that allows Russia’s neighbor to join NATO once its missing ratifications — from Hungary and Turkey — are completed in the coming weeks.

title: UK Looks to ‘Imminently’ Join Trans-Pacific Trading Block
description: The UK hopes to join an 11-nation trans-Pacific trading bloc in the near future as it seeks to broaden commercial ties with the rest of the world in the wake of leaving the European Union, Business and Trade Secretary Kemi Badenoch said.

title: Denver High School Shooting Suspect Found Dead, Coroner Confirms
description: DENVER (AP) — A body found in the Colorado woods near an abandoned car was that of a 17-year-old student accused of wounding two administrators in a shooting at his Denver high school, a coroner's office said.

title: International Arrest Warrant Against Putin Isn’t Binding in Hungary, Minister Says
description: The international arrest warrant against Russian President Vladimir Putin for war crimes committed in Ukraine isn’t binding in Hungary, Cabinet Minister Gergely Gulyas said.

title: President-Elect Leaves Nigeria to Rest in Europe After Campaign
description: Nigeria’s president-elect left the country Tuesday to rest after his recent electoral campaign, his office said.

title: Tim Cook and Ray Dalio Among Few US Chiefs Attending China Business Summit
description: China is betting on a high-profile corporate summit this weekend in Beijing to show the world that it’s back in business.

title: Orban Opens New Front in Clash Over Hungary’s 18% Interest Rate
description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban reined in the central bank’s ability to tighten monetary policy, deepening a standoff with rate setters over the European Union’s highest inflation.

title: Xi’s Ukraine Cease-Fire Call Leaves Washington Uneasy
description: Chinese President Xi Jinping is stirring unease in Washington with his call for a cease-fire in Ukraine.

title: Northrop’s $96 Billion Nuclear Missile Risks Delays, the US Air Force Finds
description: The US Air Force and Defense Department are facing potential schedule delays for the new intercontinental ballistic missile that’s central to efforts to modernize the nation’s nuclear arsenal, less than three years into its development.

title: Warren Wants Biden’s Fed Vice Chair Pick to Be Tougher on Banks
description: Senator Elizabeth Warren was focused before the banking turmoil on getting President Joe Biden to name a Federal Reserve vice chair who would resist Jerome Powell’s rate increases. Now, she wants a nominee who wants tougher bank regulation, too.

title: US Navy Denies China’s Claim That It Drove Away Destroyer
description: The US Navy hit back at the Chinese military over a claim it drove off a destroyer sailing in the South China Sea, the latest in a series of disputes between the nations.

title: US Seeks Exemption From EU Carbon Border Levy to End Tariff Dispute
description: The US has asked for its steel and aluminum exports to be exempt from the European Union’s carbon border levy as part of ongoing talks to find a permanent solution to a dispute over metals tariffs the allies imposed on each other.

title: South African Labor Union to Strike at Walmart’s Local Unit
description: Walmart Inc.’s South African unit faces a renewed risk of a strike after failing to convince the labor union that represents the biggest contingent of its workforce to accept its pay increase offer.

title: EU Eyes New Funds of Up to €500 Million to Help Ammunition Firms
description: The European Union plans to spend between €300 million ($327 million) and €500 million to support ammunition producers through the bloc’s budget, according to European Commissioner Thierry Breton.

title: After Drone Success, Turkey to Test Locally Made Tank Just in Time For Election
description: Turkey could start testing a locally made tank in April, expanding a growing arsenal of national military hardware championed by President Recep Tayyip Erdogan weeks before the toughest election of his career.

title: Japan Ends Curbs on Exports of Chip Materials to South Korea
description: Japan ended restrictions on exports to South Korea of three key compounds used in the manufacture of semiconductors and displays, in the latest step toward improving long fractious ties between the two US allies.

title: Ukraine Latest: EU Leaders to Sign Off on Military Aid for Kyiv
description: European Union leaders will sign off on plans to send Kyiv 1 million rounds of ammunition within 12 months during their meeting in Brussels.

title: India Court Sentences Rahul Gandhi to Jail for Mocking Modi
description: Rahul Gandhi, the senior leader of India’s main opposition Congress party, has been convicted by a local court of defamation and sentenced to two years in jail after allegedly making offensive remarks in 2019 about Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s surname.

title: China’s New Premier Puts Focus on Manufacturing on First Trip
description: Chinese Premier Li Qiang used his first trip out of Beijing since getting the job to reiterate Xi Jinping’s call to boost innovation and self-reliance, underscoring the priority the Asian nation places on countering US efforts to curb its tech ambitions.

title: Malaysia Plans to End Life Sentencing in Slew of Prison Reforms
description: Malaysia plans to do away with life imprisonment and drop capital punishment for six offenses, as the new government seeks to reform the Southeast Asian nation’s criminal justice system.

title: China Plays Up Friendship With Philippines as US Alliance Gains
description: China struck a cordial tone in talks with the Philippines on Thursday, seeking “friendly consultation” to settle dispute as South China Sea tensions rise and the US strengthens ties with its longstanding ally.

title: China’s Australia Ambassador Says Threat of War Not ‘Realistic’
description: China’s ambassador to Australia has dismissed concerns over a war between the two countries as unrealistic, as defense officials from both governments met for talks in Canberra in the latest sign of a diplomatic thaw.

title: Macron Challenged by New Strikes as He Pursues Pension Reform
description: French President Emmanuel Macron is facing yet more strikes against his push to reform the country’s pension system a day after he insisted he won’t back down and likened protesters to the rebels who stormed the US Capitol.

title: Putin’s Mercenary Prigozhin Shifts Focus After Ukraine Setbacks
description: Yevgeny Prigozhin, the powerful founder of mercenary group Wagner, is preparing to scale back his private army’s operations in Ukraine after Russian military chiefs succeeded in cutting key supplies of men and munitions, people familiar with the matter said.

title: Canada Lawmaker Resigns From Government Over China Allegation
description: A Canadian lawmaker has resigned from Justin Trudeau’s governing Liberal Party caucus after a media report alleged he spoke to Chinese diplomats in Toronto in 2021 and advised them not to release two imprisoned Canadians for political reasons.

title: US Fears a War-Weary World May Embrace China’s Ukraine Peace Bid
description: Xi Jinping’s meetings in Moscow with Vladimir Putin put the Biden administration in an uncomfortable position: on the sidelines as two adversaries discuss a Ukraine peace proposal that the US has deemed unacceptable.

title: Brazil Watchdog Says Bolsonaro Must Give Up Jewels From Saudi Arabia
description: SAO PAULO (AP) — A Brazilian government watchdog voted Wednesday to give former President Jair Bolsonaro five working days to return to authorities a set of jewels he received from Saudi Arabia in 2021.
